main event: On 6 December 1954, a bright, round object emitting a bright light was sighted in the sky over University City, Missouri. It was visible for approximately 15 minutes and disappeared in a southeasterly direction.
interesting points: The object appeared to be moving at a high rate of speed and made no sound.
It was visible against the clear sky, and no other witnesses to this sighting have been located.
The object came down like a shot and had stopping and starting motion.
The report indicates the source as a civilian, and the observation was categorized as a ground-radar type.
Possible conclusions for the observation included 'Was Balloon', 'Probably Balloon', 'Other: Insufficient Data for Evaluation', and more.
sighted object: Bright, round object emitting a bright light
